author: javiertc86
title: Tangopay (Merchant Payments)
description: Adoption will require payments in Ada, not going to a CEX to exchange it for FIAT currency.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal certainly addresses the challenge and meets a known need in the Cardano ecosystem. A payment processor that would allow seamless P2P financial transfers via QR code or payment links would be useful and effective. 

Ease of payment is an essential component of massive mainstream adoption. Even if ADA is never used as a true replacement for fiat, the ability to easily transfer ADA in exchange for products will still be useful to a significant number of ADA holders.

This proposal does however need a better description of how this particular payment processor implementation would be a significant advantage over simple wallet to wallet transactions.
f6_assessments.q1:
From the roadmap that is laid out in the proposal, the pacing of the work seems on par with what will be feasible given the size and experience of the team. The team already has a website up and running, with work already done and code already written. This is a good indication that they have both the ability and drive to push to project completion. The roadmap is not too ambitious, but lays out a reasonable timeframe for delivery. Also, the technology backing this proposal is not something entirely new and innovative (as similar projects have already been completed on the Ethereum chain), which further assures its feasibility. 

There are also attached images of a proof of concept layout, showing how the payment  processor intends to look from the client side. This adds a lot to my faith in the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability section in this proposal features the same roadmap as the feasibility section, which I think is a mistake. It makes the proposal look low effort and reduces trust in the team’s ability to bring forth an auditable product. 

The ability to look into the progress of a project such as this, especially with the request of $80,000, is essential to securing funding and reducing the incidence of fraud on the Catalyst platform. 

More work should be done here to create a mechanism of showing progress made on the project.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about creating a ada payment system for merchants. This can be a good idea in some instances, but I think that doing commerce activities with ada can be very risky. I think that stablecoins are more suitable for certain commerce activities. I don’t know how the proposers take this into consideration but it is a question worth outlining. Besides that, I think that it can be a good idea to create payment in ada and integrate it into the most popular ecommerce platforms like shopify and woocommerce. As a digital marketer, I have used these platforms and see a use case of an ada payment provider.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have included all the necessary information to make this proposal a success. They have done a good job by explaining how they will tackle the problem. They have provided a roadmap with a timetable to complete the work. They also have broken down the budget into identifiable items. As a digital marketer, I know on average the rates of developers, that’s why I can say the budget is reasonable. Furthermore, they have added links to the linkedin profiles of the members. Altogether, I have good confidence in the successful implementation of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers have done a good job by including information that will help track the progress of this proposal. They have provided a roadmap with milestones up to 6 month of deliverables. They have also included metrics / KPIs that define the success of the project. In fact they expect to acquire 200 to 300 customers in the first 3 months. They also want to push content on youtube and write blog posts. Altogether, I think that the proposers have provided all in the informations for the project, to be successfully audited.

f6_assessments.q0:
Tangopay is envisioning a world of payment services around the cardano blockchain. The service will offer its customer their unique wallet address with full custody of their own funds. And supply a Open source kits for the major eCommerce businesses. As well as a PoS (in person payment system) for selling products and services for small shops. 
This opens the market to many cardano wallet holders and will also motivate people to post their products and services and accept cardano as a main method of payment. The impact it can have would be a very positive one.
The major impact is that the team commits to provde thre main Opensource SDK or kits that will allow other wallets/cardano Dapps to utilize the payment system to major eCommerce and PoS systems that they will code.
f6_assessments.q1:
Javier Leonel and Manual are all well versed in the ecommerce and cardano ecosystem. They also operate a SPO and have participated in other Bridge project such a Milkomedia. 
The timeline is to complete the project in less than 6 months with a commitment to onboard customers within the first 3 months. 
The budget is a fair well paid fulltime for the main teamembers, this will allow them to fully commit for this project and deliver a sound and complete package. 
Finally the project milestones and KPI are very clear and well described.
f6_assessments.q2:
Offering the many SDK and  Plugins as open source on Github will be a key auditable point. As well as the many testnet and mainnet milestones listed to this project. The team are highly transparent and members of the cardano community in various projects (SPO Tango and Milkomedia bridge) 
My conclusion is that this project can be accurately followed for its progress over the github posts and tsting the final wallet/PoS system they develop.

solution: Tangopay makes it easier than ever to accept payments in Ada in a peer to peer fashion from anywhere at any time.
experience: We built Tangocrypto Software as a Service (https://www.tangocrypto.com), cardano-wallet-js (https://github.com/tango-crypto/cardano-wallet-js) and operate the stake pool TANGO. We are also one of the first 11 initial validators for Milkomeda.
